description:
Made with pure maple syrup. Add water, stir, and microwave. A warm, fresh flapjack on the go. Kodiak Cakes started out of a red wagon. Whole grains taste better. 100% whole grain; 260 calories; 6 g protein; 4 g fiber; all natural.

Directions
1. Remove sealed lid. 2. Add 1/4 cup cold water to flapjack cup. 3. Stir until combined. 4. Microwave on high for 1 minute, may need extra 10-15 seconds if wet spots are larger than dime size. Caution: Cup and contents will be hot.

description:
Since we introduced our easy-as-pie crust mix in 1932, we've been finding delicious ways to bring people together. To this day, our family still loves creating mixes to make and share with the people you love.

Directions
6-7 (4-inch) Pancakes: 1 cup mix; 2/3 cup cold water. 12-14 (4-inch) Pancakes: 2 cups mix; 1-1/3 cups cold water. 18-21 (4-inch) Pancakes: 3 cups mix; 2 cups cold water. Tip: For thicker pancakes, add more mix.
1. Heat griddle to 375 degrees F. Heat pancake griddle to 375 degrees F (medium heat). Lightly grease griddle.
2. Whisk pancake mix and water. Whisk pancake mix and water. Batter will be slightly lumpy. Do not over-mix. Let batter stand 2 minutes. Pour slightly less than 1/4 cup batter per pancake onto griddle.
3. Cook until golden. Cook pancakes 1 to 1-1/4 minutes per side, or until golden brown, turning only once.
High Altitude: No adjustment necessary.
title: Krusteaz Pancake Mix Buttermilk - 32oz

description:
Betty Crocker Bisquick Pancake Mix Shake 'n Pour Buttermilk 10.6oz Plastic Bottle. Makes 12-15 pancakes - just add water! Directions
Do not eat raw pancake batter.
1. Add 1-1/2 cups cool water to container; replace lid tightly.
2. Shake container hard for 30 seconds. Tap bottom corners of container to loosen remaining mix; shake again.
3. Pour batter onto hot greased skillet forming 4-inch pancakes (if batter is too thick, add up to 1 tbsp cool water).
High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): No change. Refrigerate batter up to 3 days.
title: Bisquick Shake 'N Pour Buttermilk Pancake Mix - 300 g

description:
Since we introduced our easy-as-pie crust mix in 1932, we've been finding delicious ways to bring people together. To this day, our family still loves creating mixes to make and share with the people you love. Carton made from 100% recycled paperboard. Minimum 35% post-consumer content.

Directions
2-3 (7-inch) Round Waffles: 1-1/2 cups mix; 2/3 cup water; 1 egg(s); 3 tbsp oil. 4-5 (7-inch) Round Waffles: 3 cups mix; 1-1/3 cups water; 2 egg(s); 1/3 cup oil. 9-10 (7-inch) Round Waffles: full box mix; 2-3/4 cups water; 4 egg(s); 2/3 cup oil. Tip: For best results, use cold water.
1. Heat waffle iron. Heat and lightly grease waffle iron.
2. Whisk waffle mix, water, egg(s) and oil. Whisk waffle mix, water, egg(s) and oil until smooth. Let batter stand 2 minutes. Pour about 2/3 cup batter onto waffle iron.
3. Cook until golden. Cook waffles 3-4 minutes or until golden brown.
High Altitude: No adjustment necessary.

description:
Directions
To Measure Bisquick Gluten Free Mix: Spoon into dry-ingredient measuring cup; level with knife. To maintain freshness, refrigerate after opening. Pancakes: 1 cup Bisquick Gluten Free mix; 1 cup milk; 2 tbsp vegetable oil; 1 egg. Stir ingredients until blended. Pour slightly less than 1/4 cupfuls onto hot greased griddle. Cook until edges are dry. Turn; cook until golden. 10 pancakes.
High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): No change. Waffles: 1-1/3 cups Bisquick Gluten Free mix; 1-1/4 cups milk; 3 tbsp vegetable oil; 1 egg. Stir ingredients until blended. Pour onto center of hot greased waffle maker; close lid. Bake about 5 min or until steaming stops. Carefully remove waffle. 8 (4-inch) waffles.
High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): No change. Biscuits: 2 cups Bisquick Gluten Free mix; 1/3 cup shortening; 2/3 cup milk; 3 eggs. Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Cut shortening into mix, using fork, until particles are size of small peas. Stir in remaining ingredients until soft dough forms. Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 13-16 min or until golden brown. 10 biscuits.
High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): No change. Always read labels to make sure each recipe ingredient is gluten free. Products and ingredient sources can change.
title: Bisquick Gluten Free Pancake & Baking Mix - 16oz

bullets: Made in a gluten free processing facility
soft_bullets.title: highlights

description:
Directions
To maintain freshness store in refrigerator or in a cool dry place. Kodiak Cakes Flapjack & Waffle Mix can be used as a healthy alternative in recipes. Simply substitute 1 cup flour with 1 cup Kodiak Cakes and omit salt and baking powder. Flapjack Directions: To make about six, 4 inch flapjacks blend or whisk: 1 cup mix; 1 cup cold water (For thicker flapjacks, add less water; add more water for thinner flapjacks. Do not over beat batter. For best results use batter within 15 minutes). Pour 1/4 cup batter on a preheated, lightly oiled griddle set at 375 F, or on a skillet set at medium. The griddle or skillet is ready when a drop of water spatters on the heated surface before evaporating. Flip flapjacks after bubbles stop forming and bottom side is golden brown (should take about one minute to cook first side, adjust heat accordingly). Cook opposite side until golden brown (should take about 30 seconds). Waffle Directions: To make about eight, 4 inch waffles blend or whisk: 1 cup mix; 1 cup cold water; 1 tbsp. oil (optional). Cook waffles on a preheated, lightly oiled waffle iron until steam stops and waffles are golden brown (waffle iron lid should lift without sticking).
title: Kodiak SuperFood Mix - 20 oz

bullets: Made with 100% whole grain chia, flax, quinoa, oats, & wheat

description:
Krusteaz pancakes cook up light, fluffy and delicious. One bite and you'll know why Krusteaz is such a cherished Northwest tradition.

Directions
Easy Pancake: 6-7 4-inch pancakes: 1-1/4 cups mix; 3/4 cup water. 12-14 4-inch pancakes: 2-1/2 cup mix; 1-1/2 cups water. 18-21 4-inch pancakes: 3-3/4 cups mix; 2-1/4 cups water. Important: water level may be varied depending on desired thickness of pancakes.
1. Blend cold water and mix together with a wire whip. Batter will be slightly lumpy. (Do not overmix.)
2. Pour slightly less than 1/4 cup batter per pancake onto lightly greased and preheated 375 degrees F griddle (medium heat).
3. Cook pancakes 1-1/4 to 1-1/2 minutes per side, or until golden brown, turning only once. Easy Waffle Directions (Makes 12, 4-inch Waffles):
1. Blend 2-1/2 cups mix, 1-1/4 cups cold water and 2 tablespoons oil together. Batter will be slightly lumpy. (Do not overmix.)
2. Pour batter onto lightly greased and preheated waffle iron.
3. Cook waffles until steaming stops, about 5 minutes, or until golden brown. Quick and Easy Ideas: Add the following ingredients for each 1-1/4 cups of mix used. Berry Pancakes: Gently fold 1/4 cup fresh or frozen blueberries or raspberries into batter.
Banana Walnut Pancakes: Stir 1/4 cup sliced bananas and 2 tablespoons chopped walnuts into batter.
title: Krusteaz Pancake Wheat & Honey Mix - 32oz

soft_bullets.title: highlights

description:
Betty Crocker Bisquick Baking Mix, Complete Pancake and Waffle Mix, Buttermilk with Whole Grain, 28 Oz Box is a great pantry staple. Make a delicious meal with this whole grain pancake mix that makes fluffy, mouth-watering pancakes, waffles, and more! Prepare whole grain baking mix without the mess; just add water and pour onto griddle for a wholesome snack within minutes - quick and easy! Use as waffle mix or pancake mix to create a variety of whole grain recipes the whole family will love; perfect for breakfast, lunch, dinner or dessert - endless options! Each pancake has 12g of whole grain per serving (48g recommended daily).

Directions
To maintain freshness, store in airtight container. Pancakes: To make 6 or 7 pancakes, 1 cup mix, 2/3 cup cold water; to make 12 to 14 pancakes, 2 cups mix, 1-1/3 cups cold water; to make 20-22 pancakes, 3 cups mix, 2 cups cold water.
1. Heat skillet or griddle over Medium-High heat or to 375 degrees F. Grease with vegetable oil or shortening. (Surface is ready when drops of water jump around).
2. Stir pancake mix and cold water (milk can be used instead of the water) with fork or wire whisk until smooth (batter will be thin). (for thicker pancakes, stir in additional mix) Pour slightly less than 1/4 cup batter into hot greased skillet for each pancake.
3. Cook until bubbles break on surface and edges just begin to dry. Turn; cook about 1 minute or until golden brown.
High Altitude (3500-6500 feet): No change. Tips: To Reheat Pancakes: Microwave 1 to 2 pancakes on High 10 to 20 seconds. Or place in single layer on ungreased cookie sheet and cover tightly with foil; heat in 375 degree F oven about 10 minutes. To Keep Pancakes Warm: Place on paper towel-lined cookie sheet in 200 degree F oven. Waffles:
1. Heat waffle maker.
2. Beat 2 cups Pancake Mix, 1-1/4 cups cold water (milk can be used instead of the water) and 2 tablespoons vegetable oil with fork or wire whisk until smooth. Pour onto center of greased waffle maker.
3. Bake about 5 minutes or until steaming stops. Remove carefully. 6 (9-inch) waffles.
High Altitude (3500-6500 feet): Add 1/4 cup all-purpose flour to the mix and increase oil to 1/3 cup.
title: Bisquick Complete Simply Buttermilk with Whole Grain Pancake & Waffle Mix - 28oz

Since we introduced our easy-as-pie crust mix in 1932, we've been finding delicious ways to bring people together. To this day, our family still loves creating mixes to make and share with the people you love.

Directions
6-7 (4-inch) Pancakes: 1 cup mix; 2/3 cup cold water. 12-14 (4-inch) Pancakes: 2 cups mix; 1-1/3 cups cold water. 18-21 (4-inch) Pancakes: 3 cups mix; 2 cups cold water. Tip: For thicker pancakes, add more mix.
1. Heat griddle to 375 degrees F. Heat pancake griddle to 375 degrees F (medium heat). Lightly grease griddle.
2. Whisk pancake mix and water. Whisk pancake mix and water. Batter will be slightly lumpy. Do not over-mix. Let batter stand 2 minutes. Pour slightly less than 1/4 cup batter per pancake onto griddle.
3. Cook until golden. Cook pancakes 1 to 1-1/4 minutes per side, or until golden brown, turning only once.

description:
Bisquick Heart Smart is low in fat, low in saturated fat and naturally cholesterol free. A delicious way to be good to your heart!

Directions
Do not eat raw batter. To Measure Bisquick Mix: Spoon into dry-ingredient measuring cup; level with knife. Do not sift. To maintain freshness, refrigerate after opening. Pancakes: Prep Time: 2 minutes. Cook Time: 3 minutes per batch. 2 cups Bisquick Heart Smart mix; 1-1/4 cups fat-free (skim milk); 1 egg. Stir ingredients until blended. Pour by slightly less than 1/4 cupfuls onto hot greased griddle. Cook until bubbles break on surface. Turn; cook until golden. 14 pancakes. Melt-in-Your-Mouth Pancakes: Stir in 2 tbsp sugar and 1 tsp vanilla with the egg.
High Altitude (3500-6500 feet): No change. Heart Healthy Pancakes: Increase fat-free (skim) milk to 1-1/3 cups and use 2 egg whites instead of 1 egg.
title: Bisquick Heart Smart Reduced Fat Pancake and Baking Mix - 40oz

description:
Directions
To Prepare: 13-14 4-inch Pancakes: 1-3/4 cups mix, 1 cup cold water, 1/3 cup milk, 1 egg; 26-28 4-inch Pancakes: Full box mix, 2 cups cold water, 2/3 cup milk, 2 eggs.
1. Heat pancake griddle to 375 degrees F (medium heat). Lightly grease griddle.
2. Stir pancake mix, water, milk and egg(s) together with a wire whisk. Batter will be slightly lumpy. (Do not overmix. For best results, use batter immediately). Pour slightly less than 1/4 cup batter per pancake onto griddle.
3. Cook pancakes 1-1/2 minutes per side, or until golden brown, turning only once.
High Altitude: No adjustment necessary.
title: Krusteaz Gluten Free Pancake Mix - 16 oz
